terms.value: Malopolska Centre of Biotechnology, Jagiellonian University

description: Conclusion: Our study showed DE of proteins involved in metabolic and cellular processes, indicative of impaired hepatic functions which may contribute to the onset and progression of various diseases (e.g. NASH, NAFLD, hepatocarcinoma) in mouse offspring developed following ART. Moreover, impaired hepatic metabolism was associated with obesity, glucose intolerance, insulin resistance and dyslipidaemia which are core symptoms of metabolic syndrome and risk factor for diabetes and cardiovascular diseases in adult ART offspring. Thus, we provide evidence of Assisted Reproductive Technologies is a risk factor for perturbation of hepatic proteome, associated with the increased predisposition to liver diseases and metabolic syndrome in adulthood.

keywords.name: submitter keyword

title: Perturbations of hepatic proteome behind the onset of metabolic disorders in mouse offspring developed following assisted reproductive technologies
